text: Answer (a,d) Solution: (@) aib is the only language which requires only one stack alphabet, And the logic is push 1 on each ‘@’ and the pop 1 at each ‘D', in last stack must be empty. Option (b) & () requires two stack alphabet, but option (d) is regular (equivalent to (a+b)*) and it doesn't require stack. So, it can be easily accepted by given DCA. So, option (a) & (d) are correct. Answer: a, d
